description.value:
.

The lizard-orc wizard attempts to rip open the fabric of reality, creating a wave of unstable energy at point it can see within 60 ft. All creatures in a 20 ft. radius of that point must make a DC 15 constitution saving throw, taking 6d8 force damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. If a target fails this save, it must make a DC 15 wisdom saving throw to avoid being frightened of the space where the wave originated. The creature can attempt another save when the lizard-orc wizard dies, or when 1 hour has passed.

When the mutant warrior has fewer than all of its hit points, its flesh attempts to knit itself together, spewing volatile organic compounds as it does so.

All creatures within 5 ft. of the mutant warrior, including the mutant warrior, must succeed on a DC 13 contitution saving throw or take 2d6 poison damage (which the mutant warrior is resistant to). Then, if this doesn't kill the mutant warrior, the mutant warrior regains 5 hit points.

If the mutant warrior isn't in danger and is at 15 hit points or greater, assume that it can regain all hit points over the course of 10 minutes without any danger.

description.chatFlavor: If the Mutant Warrior is still alive after using this ability, they regain 5 hit points.

description.value: The mutant warrior was created through unstable magic. When it dies, all creatures within 10 ft. of the mutant must make a DC 13 constitution saving throw or take 4d10 poison damage and be poisoned for one minute (save for half damage) (save ends).

Stretching out your hands, crackling flames extend between your fingertips, then strike outwards in a beam to burn everything in its path.

1 Action - 30 ft. Line (5 ft. Radius) - 2nd Level - VS

Dexterity Save

  • Failure: Target takes 4d6 fire damage.*

  • Success: Half damage.

*At Higher Levels: For every spell slot level above 2nd, the damage increases by 1d6.

This ability is meant to be used after casting Rend the Veil to automate the frightened effect it causes.

60 ft. Radius

Wisdom Save

  • Failure: Target is frightened of the center of this effect for 1 minute (save ends).

  • Success: No effect.

materials.value: A warped tuning fork meant for teleportation to another plane

description.value:
Note: casting this spell requires a damaged tuning fork, typically valued at 50 gold. The tuning fork is not consumed by the spell.

You hold out a damaged tuning fork attuned to another plane. You utter a corrupted version of the incantation needed to teleport to another plane, instead ripping a hole in space. All creatures you choose within 60 ft. of the tear are compelled to flee from it, and the area around the rip is twisted.

1 Action - 20 ft. Radius (60 ft.) - 5th Level - VSM

Constitution Save

  • Failure: Target takes 4d8 force damage.*

  • Success: Half damage.

Additionally, all creatures who can see the rip in reality when it is formed must attempt a wisdom saving throw. See the Rend the Veil [Frighten] action for the second half of this ability's automation.

60 ft. Radius

Wisdom Save

  • Failure: Target is frightened of the center of this effect for 1 minute (save ends).

  • Success: No effect.

*At Higher Levels: For every spell slot level above 5th, the damage increases by 2d8.

materials.value: A warped tuning fork meant for teleportation to another plane

description.chatFlavor: Use the Rend the Veil [Frighten] action to automate the second half of the spell.

description.value:
You reach out as if to grasp your target, conjuring toxic mist around them.

1 Action - 1 Creature (30 ft.) - Cantrip - VS

Consitution Save

  • Failure: Target takes 1d12 poison damage.*

  • Success: No damage.

*At Higher Levels: This spell's damage increases by 1d12 when you reach a total character or creature level of 5th level (2d12), 11th level (3d12), and 17th level (4d12).

Greatswords are heavy two-handed sword designed for slashing.

Properties:

&Reference[Heavy], &Reference[Handed]
